title: Cigmund, the Magic Devourer
body:
Passive: Unquenchable Thirst
X% of all damage dealt by Cigmund is given to him as mana. Excess mana is converted into a shield with a max strength of X-X(based on level)

Q: Mana Ball
Consume X% of current of mana. Shoot a ball of magical energy in a line, dealing X/X/X/X(+X% AP)(+X% Mana Consumed). If Cigmund kills a unit with Mana ball, he gains X maximum mana, double against large minions and monsters, triple against enemy champions

W: Magic Siphon
Cigmund channels a siphoning ray of magic, draining X% of max mana per second, dealing X/X/X/X(+X% AP) magic damage per second, whilst also draining X%/X% of their Mana/Energy per second, dealing X/X/X/X extra damage per X/X mana/energy drained. If the target has no mana, the bonus damage is instead X% max HP.

E: Unlimited Power
Cigmund channels a large cone of electricity in front of him, draining X% of max mana per second, dealing X/X/X/X(+X% AP)(+X% Mana drained per second) magic damage, and slowing all enemies by X% for X seconds. For every second they are damaged by Unlimited Power, the greater the slow becomes, up to a maximum of X%.

R: EMP
Cigmund hurls a huge vortex of negative magic, which lands on the target area of effect. All enemies hit by it have X%/X%/X% of all their Mana/Energy consumed by Cigmund. All enemies who don't have mana or energy are instead silenced for X seconds. Cigmund's excess mana shield health has no max for the next X seconds upon casting

replies.body:
You don't get it, I understand.

I have beta tested for games and had entire patches made solely on my feedback. Your idea is fundamentally flawed, but keep trying, I don't mean to discourage you.

This doesn't really work.

You'd use lots of mana regen, no +max mana, and have near unlimited shield.

Stacking kills with the Q would actually have a negative effect.

The shield has max health, only when you use the ult do you have a limitless shield health
and the Q does do damage based on the mana spent. So, the more max mana you have, the more mana it can consume, to then in turn deal more damage
